page.title: 01Eastern End of Alderney C I
page.content: The eastern end of Alderney is low lying and fringed by sandyy beaches. There is evidence of pre-historic remains and it is also supposed that the area was used as a burial site by people from France 8 miles across the race. The Romans probably used Longis Bay as a staging post. There are numerous forts spanning years from 1548 Essex Castle, through the Victorian forsts of 1850's to the German structures of World War II. This area is sparsely inhabited with little cultivation but boasts Alderney's finest beaches,golf course and lighthouse.
